alert.note: Alert for Polk; Story (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 12:40PM CDT until June 16 at 7:18AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Skunk River near Ames US 30 affecting Story and Polk Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Skunk River near Ames US 30. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Water affects South 16th Street. Water also affects the sports complex along the river south of US 30. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 21.7 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 21.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 21.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
